# Tokalator

> Real-time context budget calculator for AI coding assistants. Count your tokens like beads on an abacus. A VS Code extension and open catalog of AI instructions, prompts, and agents.

Tokalator helps developers understand and optimize their AI context window usage. It provides real-time token counting with model-specific tokenizers, tab relevance scoring, and context rot warnings.

## VS Code Extension

The Tokalator extension (v3.1.1) runs inside VS Code and provides:

- A sidebar dashboard showing token budget level (LOW/MEDIUM/HIGH), per-file breakdown, and relevance scores
- A `@tokalator` chat participant with 11 commands for inline context management
- Real BPE tokenizers: Claude BPE for Anthropic models, o200k_base for OpenAI, heuristic for Gemini
- 14 built-in model profiles covering Claude Opus 4.6, Sonnet 4.5/4, Haiku 4.5, GPT-5.2, GPT-5.2 Codex, GPT-5.1, GPT-5 Mini, GPT-4.1, o3, o4-mini, Gemini 3 Pro/Flash, Gemini 2.5 Pro
- Tab relevance scoring based on import relationships, path similarity, edit recency, and diagnostics
- File pinning that persists across sessions
- Context rot warnings when conversation turns exceed model-specific thresholds
- Next turn preview with growth projections and overflow warnings
- High Contrast Dark/Light theme support

### Chat Commands

- `@tokalator /count` — Current token count and budget level
- `@tokalator /breakdown` — See where tokens are going
- `@tokalator /optimize` — Close low-relevance tabs
- `@tokalator /pin <file>` — Pin a file as always-relevant
- `@tokalator /unpin <file>` — Unpin a file
- `@tokalator /instructions` — List instruction files and their token cost
- `@tokalator /model [name]` — Show or switch the active model (syncs to VS Code settings)
- `@tokalator /compaction` — Per-turn token growth and compaction recommendations
- `@tokalator /preview` — Preview token cost of your next message before sending
- `@tokalator /reset` — Reset session state (clear turn counter)
- `@tokalator /exit` — End the current session and save summary

### Configuration

- `tokalator.model` — AI model to calculate budget against (default: claude-opus-4.6)
- `tokalator.relevanceThreshold` — Tabs below this score are marked low-relevance (default: 0.3)
- `tokalator.windowSize` — Context window size override in tokens (default: 1,000,000)
- `tokalator.contextRotWarningTurns` — Warn about context rot after this many chat turns (default: 20)
- `tokalator.autoRefreshInterval` — Dashboard refresh interval in ms (default: 2000)

## Open Catalog

The Tokalator website hosts a curated catalog of AI coding resources:

- 146+ agent definitions (.agent.md files)
- 140+ reusable prompts (.prompt.md files)
- 161+ instruction sets (.instructions.md files)
- 39+ curated collections (.collection.yml files)

Resources span multiple ecosystems: GitHub Copilot, Claude Code, and universal formats.

## Tools

- Token Calculator — count tokens across different models and tokenizers
- Context Window Visualizer — see how your context budget is distributed
- Caching ROI Analyzer — break-even analysis for prompt caching
- Multi-Provider Compare — compare costs across Anthropic, OpenAI, and Google
